frameDefinitions: A Financial_instrument (a bond or insurance) fulfills a condition at a certain Time after which the Issuer of the Financial_instrument is legally obligated to pay the Holder a monetary Value, based on the instrument's original Principle and the Interest rate.
An Evaluator participates in an Experience (or metonymically, a salient Entity of the Experience), often for the first time, in order to form an opinion about its quality.
A Process is finished and can no longer proceed.
This frame contains (transparent ) nouns that are Units of measurement for time.
A Process comes to an end.
A Self_mover leaves an initial Source location.
frameExamples: The bond had <t>matured</t> to its full value at 30 years.
Have you <t>tried</t> my latest get-rich-quick scheme? INI
The final total was 606, scored in only 10 <t><fex name='Unit'>hours</fex></t> of excellent batsmanship.
listRoleDefinitions: The bond, insurance, or debt security which a Holder buys from an Issuer.
When the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> reaches maturity.
The person (or metonymic manifestation thereof) that participates in the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The activity or event that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> participates in.
<fen>Entity</fen> is something that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> uses to try an <fen>Experience</fen>, and metonymically stands in for the <fen>Experience</fen>.
A more explicit description of what the <fen>Evaluator</fen> seeks to learn by having the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The temporal location during which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
The physical location in which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the name of the <fen>Process</fen> that occurs.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The number of <fen>Unit</fen>s of the measured entity.
The standardized quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured.
The activity or state that takes place during the period of time under discussion.
Name of the event which occurs.
When the event ends.
Where the event takes place.
This is the entity which moves under its own power.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
listRoleExamples: <fex>She</fex> tested out six cars before finding the one she liked.
Have you ever tried <fex>working out with kettlebells?</fex>
We tried out <fex>the games</fex>, and they're fun.
I tried out my neighbors vacuums <fex>to see if they met my needs</fex>
I tried it for the first time <fex>at home</fex>.
The ads had been absorbed into her brain during <fex>many</fex> <fex>hours</fex> of television watching.
Seven <fex>hours</fex> of torrential rain reduced the pitch to a lake.
He had to listen to almost two <fex>hours</fex> <fex>of complaints</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: PostScript Printer Driver Optimization Case Study

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Xerox Palo Alto Research Center
